results.title: Thomson of Arnhem Land
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, John Moore Productions, Michael McMahon, John Moore and Michael Cummins
results.brief_description: In the 1930s tensions between the government and the indigenous people of Australia’s North were on a knife-edge. Donald Thomson, an anthropologist, volunteered to go to Arnhem Land to make peace. For over two years, he lived with the Aboriginal people, forging strong bonds, learning and recording their way of life. His report to the government outlined a vision of land rights and other measures to protect a unique yet fragile culture. It was ignored. Ostracised by politicians and fellow academics, Thomson never gave up the struggle for Aboriginal rights. Now, his extraordinary photographs, field notes and artefacts are considered one of the most significant ethnographic collections in the world. Thomson’s collection is held at the Museum of Victoria in Melbourne. Narrated by Anni Finsterer. Music by David Bridie.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, John Moore Productions, Michael McMahon, John Moore and Michael Cummins

results.title: Thomastown (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Latrobe University. School of Education. Media Centre, Lee Burton and Robert Newton
results.brief_description: Thomastown High School allows students the freedom and responsibility to shape their own learning experiences and their own learning. This program is an account of the curriculum innovation at Thomastown High School, Victoria, between 1971-1982. Uses animation as well as live-action. Narrated by Lee Burton.

results.title: Thomas the Tank Engine; Thomas and Gordon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Britt Allcroft Co, Britt Allcroft and David Mitton
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Thomas the tank engine & friends”.
It’s full steam ahead for Thomas, the little blue engine with the short, stumpy funnel, short, stumpy boiler and short, stumpy dome and his special friends Gordon, Henry, James, Percy, Edward, Toby and Annie and Clarabel the carriages, and of course their boss, the Fat Controller. His friend, stroyteller Ringo Starr, says “Thomas is number one and never lets anyone forget it!” Based on The Railway Series by Rev W. Awdry.

results.title: Thomas L'imposteur = Thomas the Imposter
results.brief_description:
Thomas is a 16 year old who poses as the nephew of a general to help a princess get to Paris during World War I. She helps wounded soldiers by taking them back to her castle for medical care.

Credits: Producer, Eugene Lepicier ; director, Georges Franju ; writers, Jean Cocteau, Michel Worms, Georges Franju, Raphael Cluzel ; photography, Marcel Fradetal ; music, Georges Auric.
Cast: Emmanuelle Riva, Fabrice Rouleau, Rosy Varte, Bernard Lavalette, Jean-Roger Caussimon, Michel Vitold, Gabrielle Dorziat, Jean Marais.
